summary: SkillSprint ‚Äì 7 Day Skill Builder: A web app that generates structured 7-day skill-building execution plans. Users select a skill, set hours/day, skill level, and desired outcome. AI outputs a structured plan with daily objectives, tasks, exercises, deliverables, and estimated time. Features a colorful, gamified, Gen-Z-friendly UI with animations/sliding transitions, interactive progress tracker, improvement graph, and personalized learning experience. Includes PDF download. Payment system is simplified: Day 2‚Äì7 remain permanently locked with blur; paywall section shows UPI ID, static QR code, and WhatsApp number for screenshot-based manual unlock (no in-app transaction ID input or auto-unlock).
architectural_notes: Colorful, gamified Gen-Z UI: vibrant multi-color theme, sliding/animated transitions, micro-animations on interactive elements
Real UPI ID for payments: nidhi.aesticare@okhdfcbank ‚Äî must be used everywhere in the payment section, no placeholders
Day plan content generation must be dynamic and index-aware ‚Äî each day (1‚Äì7) must receive unique, progressively harder content; no static template text or Day 1 placeholder reuse allowed
Payment system is static/manual only: no transaction ID input, no backend verification, no auto-unlock. Day 2‚Äì7 are permanently blurred. Users pay via UPI and submit screenshot on WhatsApp.

existing_features.title: Build a skill input form page as the app's landing/home screen. The form must include: (1) a skill selector ‚Äî a dropdown with popular skills (e.g., Python, Public Speaking, UI Design, Excel, Photography, Writing) plus a 'Custom' option that reveals a text input field; (2) a hours-per-day slider ranging from 0.5 to 8 hours in 0.5 increments showing the current value; (3) a skill level selector with three buttons: Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced ‚Äî only one selectable at a time; (4) a desired outcome text input (placeholder: 'What do you want to achieve by Day 7?'); (5) a 'Generate My Sprint' CTA button. All fields are required before submission.

Build a plan results page that displays the generated sprint. The page must show: (1) a Skill Overview card at the top; (2) a day-by-day accordion or card list for Day 1‚Äì7, each showing Objective, Action Task, Practice Exercise, Deliverable, and Estimated Time; (3) an End of Week Result section; (4) a 3 Common Mistakes section with a list; (5) a Bonus Resource card with a clickable link. For locked plans (payment not done), blur or hide Day 2‚Äì7 content and show a prominent paywall overlay. Day 1 is always visible as a preview.

Implement the paywall UI and UPI payment flow. Before revealing the full sprint (Days 2‚Äì7), show a modal or inline section with: (1) headline 'Unlock Full SkillSprint ‚Äì ‚Çπ20'; (2) UPI ID to pay: display a static UPI ID (e.g., skillsprint@upi); (3) a QR code placeholder image or text instruction to pay ‚Çπ20; (4) a text input labeled 'Enter your UPI Transaction ID'; (5) a 'Verify & Unlock' button. On submission, call the backend submitTransactionId method. On success, reload the plan in unlocked state. Show an error message if the transaction ID field is empty.

Add an interactive progress tracker UI to the plan results page. Display a progress bar and a 7-day checklist where users can mark each day as complete by clicking a checkbox or toggle. The progress bar must update in real-time to reflect the percentage of days completed (e.g., 3/7 = 43%). Store progress state in frontend local state (no backend persistence required). The tracker must be clearly labeled and mobile-friendly.

Add a 'Download PDF' button to the unlocked plan results page. When clicked, generate a PDF client-side using a library such as jsPDF or the browser's print dialog (window.print with a print-specific CSS class). The PDF must include: Skill name, level, hours/day, desired outcome, Skill Overview, all 7 days with their full fields, End of Week Result, Common Mistakes, and Bonus Resource. The button must only be visible/active after the plan is unlocked.

Apply a clean, modern light-theme visual design consistently across the entire app. Use blue as the primary accent color (e.g., #2563EB or similar), white/light gray backgrounds, rounded cards with subtle shadows, and a clean sans-serif typography. All interactive elements (buttons, sliders, checkboxes) must have clear hover and active states. The layout must be fully mobile responsive with a max content width of ~800px centered on desktop. Use Tailwind CSS utility classes throughout.

Update the PlanResults page (frontend/src/pages/PlanResults.tsx) to correctly read and render all five fields per day card ‚Äî Objective, Action Task, Practice Exercise, Deliverable, and Estimated Time ‚Äî from the plan data returned by the backend. Ensure the field-to-display mapping matches the backend data structure field names exactly (e.g., actionTask, practiceExercise, estimatedTime). Each day card must display all five fields with clear labels, and none of them should appear blank when the backend returns populated data.

Redesign the entire app with a vibrant, colorful Gen-Z aesthetic. Replace the current blue-only theme with a dynamic multi-color gradient palette (e.g., electric purple, hot pink, cyan, lime green, orange accents) applied across backgrounds, cards, buttons, and UI elements. Use bold, expressive typography with emoji usage throughout the plan cards and headings. Apply gradient text effects on key headings and CTAs. All cards must use vivid gradient borders or backgrounds. The design must remain mobile-responsive with max content width of 800px centered on desktop.

Add sliding and animated transitions throughout the app. Day cards on the PlanResults page must slide in sequentially with a staggered entrance animation (each card sliding up/in with a slight delay). Navigating between sections (e.g., opening a day card, switching tabs) must use smooth slide or fade transitions. The SkillInputForm page must animate each form field into view on load with a staggered slide-in effect. Use CSS keyframes or a lightweight animation approach (e.g., Tailwind animate classes or inline style transitions) ‚Äî no external animation libraries required unless already available.

Implement a gamification system on the PlanResults page with XP points, level badges, and streak indicators. Each day marked complete awards a visible XP amount (e.g., +150 XP). Display a cumulative XP counter at the top of the progress tracker that animates (counts up) when XP is earned. Show a 'streak' counter that increments for consecutive days completed. Award badge icons (e.g., üî• Streak, ‚≠ê Half Way, üèÜ Sprint Complete) when milestone thresholds are reached (e.g., 3 days = Streak badge, 7 days = Sprint Complete badge). Display earned badges in a badge shelf section below the progress tracker. All gamification state is stored in frontend local state.

Add a day-by-day progress and improvement graph to the PlanResults page. Use a bar chart (rendered via a lightweight charting approach ‚Äî e.g., inline SVG or a simple canvas-based chart) showing all 7 days on the X-axis and a completion/progress score on the Y-axis. Completed days show a filled, brightly colored bar; incomplete days show a muted/empty bar. The chart must update in real time when the user marks a day complete. Label the chart clearly as 'Your Sprint Progress' and style it to match the colorful Gen-Z theme.

Add curated study content resources to each day card on the PlanResults page. Each day card must display a 'Study Resources' section below the existing fields (Objective, Action Task, Practice Exercise, Deliverable, Estimated Time) showing 2‚Äì3 clickable resource links (e.g., articles, YouTube search links, documentation pages) relevant to that day's topic and the user's skill. Create a backend actor that stores skill sprint plans and payment verification records. The actor must support: (1) storing a generated 7-day sprint plan keyed by a unique plan ID, (2) recording a UPI transaction ID submission for a given plan ID, (3) marking a plan as unlocked after transaction ID is submitted, (4) retrieving a plan (locked state returns only overview; unlocked state returns full plan). The plan data structure must include: skillName, hoursPerDay, skillLevel (Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced), desiredOutcome, skillOverview, days (array of 7 objects each with objective, actionTask, practiceExercise, deliverable, estimatedTime), endOfWeekResult, commonMistakes (array of 3 strings), bonusResource (title + URL), and unlockedStatus (bool).

Implement deterministic plan generation logic in the backend. Given skillName, hoursPerDay, skillLevel, and desiredOutcome as inputs, generate a complete 7-day sprint plan programmatically (no external AI API). Use a structured template approach: each day's objective, actionTask, practiceExercise, deliverable, and estimatedTime are derived from the skill name, level, and hours. Include a 3-item commonMistakes array and one bonusResource with a relevant title. The output must be concise and actionable with no motivational filler text.
Fix blank day-wise content in the generated sprint plan ‚Äî each day must display actual content for Objective, Action Task, Practice Exercise, Deliverable, and Estimated Time fields

Fix the backend plan generation logic in backend/main.mo so that each of the 7 days in the generated sprint plan is populated with actual, meaningful content for all five fields: Objective, Action Task, Practice Exercise, Deliverable, and Estimated Time. The content must be derived from the inputs (skillName, hoursPerDay, skillLevel, desiredOutcome) using a structured template approach. Each day must have a distinct, progressively advancing theme (e.g., Day 1 = fundamentals/setup, Day 2 = core concept A, Day 3 = core concept B, Day 4 = practice, Day 5 = intermediate application, Day 6 = project/review, Day 7 = final deliverable/assessment). No field in any day object may be left as an empty string or placeholder.

Gamified, colorful, Gen-Z-friendly UI redesign: vibrant color palette, sliding/animated transitions between days, interactive elements with micro-animations, engaging typography and emoji usage throughout the plan
Add an improvement/progress graph visualizing user's day-by-day completion and skill progression (e.g., a bar or line chart showing days completed vs. planned)
Personalized learning experience: tailor day-wise content, tone, and resource suggestions based on user's skill level, hours/day, and desired outcome inputs
